#summary What is actually going on in the releases?

= Introduction =

The RoadMap page may be .. cluttered and disorganised. Its primarily designed so Adrian can document and keep track of what is going on.

This is a higher-level summary.

= Cacheboy-1.X =

Cacheboy-1.X is mostly focused on breaking apart the Squid codebase into higher level modules. These modules can then be tested and re-used independently of the Squid application.

== Cacheboy-1.0 ==

  * Initial port to subversion

== Cacheboy-1.1 ==

  * Initial modularity groundwork - debugging and core routines, basic HTTP types

== Cacheboy-1.2 ==

  * Further modularity groundwork - Strings, Memory allocation routines

== Cacheboy-1.3 ==

  * Further modularity work - communications, event scheduling, filedescriptor management
  * Merged in current Squid-2.HEAD changes

== Cacheboy-1.4 ==

  * Modularity work - further communications and callback management
  * Merged in current Squid-2.HEAD changes

== Cacheboy-1.5 ==

  * Modularity work - internal/external DNS, IPC helper code
  * IPv6 - core, DNS transport (internal and external)

== Cacheboy-1.6 ==

  * Modularity work - fqdncache, ipcache (the hostname<->IP translation and caches)
  * IPv6 - DNS record resolution (internal and external)
  * IPv6 - ACL source/destination IP, network, hostnames
  * IPv6 - client-side code, client database
  * IPv6 - SNMP (if possible?)

== Cacheboy-1.7 ==

  * Modularity work - HTTP core - Headers; Header and Header entry parsing; response packing
  * Performance - HTTP header parsing optimisations

== Cacheboy-1.8 ==

  * Reference counted buffers and string management
  * Replacement HTTP request/reply parser
  * Modularity work - HTTP server-side, HTTP client-side
